intro: Peristrophe cernua, commonly known as the drooping leaved spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and diverse floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has slender, creeping stems. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Peristrophe cernua produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or yellowish, surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
